Abstract: New technology in mobile devices and apps can help fight wildfires. This makes it easier for users to do daily tasks like accessing data, sharing information, and coordinating teams and vehicles. This work talks about a new mobile app for managing wildfire information that works on Windows Phone devices. It supports the web-based AEGIS platform for wildfire prevention and management.

With the AEGIS App, users can do many tasks, such as finding routes, searching for nearby facilities, and accessing firefighting support. It also provides weather data and shows fire management information like water sources, gas stations, and evacuation sites. 

A unique feature of the AEGIS App is its support from Cortana, an artificial intelligence assistant by Microsoft. Cortana allows users to access information using voice commands. The app is designed for firefighting teams in Greece and aims to improve the sharing of information and knowledge between operation centers and firefighting units in the field.
